Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Our Development Team is looking for a Senior Software Developer to join them in shaping our company by creating, enhancing, and maintaining PHP based internal and external products. As part of the team, you will work within the LAMP stack in an Agile based environment to help ensure our products provide a great user experience and significant value to the customer.

This role can be filled remotely or from one of our offices.

What You’ll Do:

Develop structured application/interface code, new program documentation, operations documentation and user guides in a casual, flexible environment
Communicate with end users and internal customers to develop, debug, and test application software for accuracy, integrity, interoperability and completeness.
Produce reliable, testable software applications using a disciplined development approach
Utilize your advanced PHP and MySQL skills to create back end tooling
Collaborate with stakeholders and leadership to prioritize and implement features
Develop new functionality and applications on cross functional Agile project teams
Review and test team member’s code to ensure the software meets our high quality standards and operates efficiently
Build your skill set in a collaborative, team-focused environment

Ideal Candidates Have:

5-8 years progressive development experience, primarily focused on web applications, back end automation
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science and/or equivalent experience
Extensive background in LAMP development
Ability to move back and forth between Front End and API Back End work
Experience with UI/UX fundamentals
Advanced experience with  PHP and MySQL
Advanced understanding of object oriented principles
Talent for building user interfaces using JS, jQuery, HTML, CSS and AJAX
Background in refactoring/verifying systems through automated testing and test-driven development in large scale systems
Experience with software deployment, Continuous Integration (CI), and Continuous Delivery (CD) concepts, applications, and tools highly preferred
Basic knowledge of the Linux/Unix command-line
Experience with MVC frameworks required, Zend Framework preferred
Advanced JavaScript experience and mid-level or better experience with one or more of the common frameworks like React or Angular is a plus
Experience in the WordPress ecosystem building or modifying plugins preferred
A passion for creating a high quality user experience
Experience with development of automated customer processes and systems

What You’ll Get:

Profit sharing twice a year
Medical, dental, vision, disability, life insurance, and 401K plans
Casual work environment and relaxed dress code
Free weekly lunch and snacks
Tuition and certification reimbursement
Opportunities for advancement after 90 days
To be a part of an incredible team in a collaborative environment

Location:

Denver, CO
Virginia Beach, VA
Remote

Now hiring a Software Engineer III

Basic Purpose of Position: Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of software engineering principles, and practices. Support, design, development and test of complex embedded software. Work with other engineering and functional areas to obtain optimum utilization of equipment, machinery and resources.

· Primary or Major Responsibilities:

· Use company policies and procedures to complete work assignments.

· Develop low-cost, high-volume software for defense and security system development.

· Design, document, develop, code and test embedded software items and test software projects.

· Identify and report critical project concerns to sustain on-track project completion.

· Support other software engineers in the software development process.

· Interface with other design personnel to design, execute and test prototype software builds.

· Design and conduct complex in-house software test.

· Participate in product software failure analysis activities and compile test and failure analysis reports.

· Generates software design documentation and report data from tests.

· Keep accurate and complete records of engineering activities.

· May provide training and/or direction to technicians.

· May provide input to bid and proposal activities.

· May provide communications and/or presentations to customers, suppliers or vendors.

· May require participation in product field tests requiring travel.

· All other duties as assigned.

Safety:

· Ensure that all assignments are performed in compliance with all applicable Federal, State, Provincial and Company safety and health regulations, and where applicable, use proper personal protective equipment.

· Minimum Requirements:

· BSCS, engineering, or related field. 2-6 years software experience.

· Knowledge/skills must include education, in, design, coding and test of embedded software systems.

· Knowledge of full software development lifecycle required.

· Experience developing embedded software in C or C++; additional languages a plus.

· Desktop and network software development experience a plus.

· Knowledge of software tools (requirements, compiler, assemblers, debuggers, programmers, JTAG, etc).

· Experience with A/D and D/A converters, and serial communications preferred.

· Knowledge of data acquisition concepts, instrument control, test, measurement, and implementation of control interfaces to hardware.

· Practical skills for bench level work, including the ability to configure test equipment to verify design.

· Able to use original thinking and ingenuity to solve problems.

· Ability to write technical report and participate in presentations.

· Proficient in MS Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)

· Must show initiative, and motivation, and have ability to act independently to resolve technical issues.

Data Processing Analyst

Commercial offset/digital print and mail facility located in Winter Park, FL is seeking a detail-oriented, responsible, production-driven, data processing analyst for full-time, long-term, day shift position. 

The primary responsibilities of this position are:

- Receive mailing lists in a variety of formats and convert to a standard (DBF) format.
- Using a combination of Microsoft Visual FoxPro (VFP) as well as in-house tools and applications:
	Perform QC check on incoming data.
	CASS certify the mailing list
	Perform merge/purge and/or suppressions as specificed by client.
	Presort (PAVE) the mailing list for the best possible postage rate.
	Output the file and all appropriate forms and paperwork for subsequent production departments.

Position-specific requirements include:

- Experience manipulating data in DBMS systems (VFP, dBase, FileMaker Pro, Access). VFP experiece a big plus, but not required. SQL familiarity a plus.
- Understanding of USPS postal regulations as they relate to mailing list preparation for various classes of mailing.
- Ability to interpret detailed and often complex data processing instructions.
- Meticulous eye for detail and spotting potential data issues and inconsistencies.

Qualified applicants should:

- Understand that exceeding client expectations is of paramount importance.
- Be proficient in Microsoft Office applications
- Be comfortable in a fast-paced, deadline-oriented environment.
- Be willing to be a team player in a family atmosphere.
- Possess strong interpersonal and communication skills.
- Be able to keep the workspace safe, tidy, and well-organized.
- Have adequate and reliable transportation.
- Be able to lift and move up to 20 lbs. without any restrictions.
- Have a high school or GED equivalent.
- Be able to pass a background check and drug test.

While often demanding, our company atmosphere is casual and convivial. We have grown to become a leader in the printing and direct mail industry in Florida through twenty years of exceeding client expectations. We are a rapidly-growing company that values honesty, integrity, and recognition of excellence. Benefits include medical, dental, paid vacations, and a matched retirement plan.

Please submit your resume for immediate consideration.

$12.00 to $18.00 per hour, depending upon experience and qualifications.

Job Tile: Use your PC or MAC to test video chat apps (remote) and make some $$
Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Do you use video chat apps? Do you like to give feedback to software developers? If so, we want to hear from you! This is a chance to you to directly impact the next generation of video chat applications and make them better for you and for everyone else.

We’re looking for people with strong communications skills to help test and evaluate our applications. Use your video-enabled PC or MAC from the comfort of your home. Once you sign up and complete our screening survey, we'll invite you to start testing.

Each quality test you complete will pay $10.00, and each test will not take more than 20 minutes. Tests will involve being on-line with many other testers at the same time, and will be announced a couple of hours in advance. Test volume fluctuates, so think of it as a way to make some extra money, and not as a source of constant income.

Your participation in the tests will allow our engineers to fine tune their hardware and software in the cloud, and your comments will go directly to our developers so they can make our apps easier to use.

Sign up for more info HERE: https://site.vuemix.com/alpha.html

To take tests and get paid, you'll need:
- A recent model, video-capable Windows PC, MAC or laptop
- A Google or Facebook account to use for login authentication
- Webcam and headset (testing will require using headsets and not speakers)
- Administrator privileges on your PC/MAC to be able to install / update software
- A 5 Mbps or faster Internet connection
- Agree to our terms and conditions as a beta tester
- Be 18 or older

We look forward to hearing from you!

Job Tile: Work from Home | Internet Analyst | Social Media Evaluator
Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Appen is seeking candidates in different countries and languages for exciting work-from-home opportunities! These opportunities range from simple surveys that can be completed in less than one hour to on-going projects that last for months or longer. We look for a variety of skill sets, from those who use social media regularly to candidates who have college degrees in linguistics.

How do I apply? Simply click on your country of residence below and complete a short registration form. Once you complete the registration form, you will be screened for eligibility. We look for candidates with a range of experience in social media, web search, mobile device usage, translation or transcription experience, degrees in linguistics, and more.

How do I get started? If you are eligible to participate, our team will send you a link to a Project Page that lists the projects available to you in your country and/or your language. There are always new and exciting projects being added so visit this page often!

Here examples of some of the opportunities that may be available:
•	Search Media Evaluation (Work with the world’s top search engine companies)
•	Social Media Evaluation (Help improve social media around the globe)
•	Translation
•	Transcription
•	Survey and Data Collection (Short projects that last from 15 minutes to three hours)
•	Linguistic Specialties (Text to Speech, Computational, Phonetics, Pronunciation, Annotation, etc.)
•	Lexicon Annotation
•	Speech Evaluation

Applicants must be self-motivated and internet savvy.

We take pride in our diverse team and our flexible work opportunities, and as a publicly traded company our efforts and earned us the first place ranking in the FlexJobs Top 100 Companies index. Deloitte also recognized Appen with the 2017 Asia Pacific Technology Fast 500 and the Technology Fast 50 Australia awards.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

To ensure that you will be profiled for any projects, please indicate your native and secondary language.

To complete your application kindly register to our applicant database through the link below:

https://connect.appen.com/qrp/public/job/view/en_US?sref=585d8785d1bd3ba7948792b6e3efb4de

Executive Assistant 

Focus School Software is a fast-growing management software company. We thrive on creating some of the most innovative features on the market today, helping educators to meet their evolving needs in classrooms, district management, state reporting compliance, and other facets of student-centered education and technology. 

Currently, Focus is looking for energetic, creative, and experienced candidates who can help us succeed in our mission to serve an increasing number of districts across the nation. We keep our clients’ needs at the forefront of everything we do, and as a company who understands the hard work of today’s educators, Focus looks for employees who share our values towards education. 

Focus is looking to expand our team by adding an Executive Assistant to support the Director of Higher Ed / CTE. The Executive Assistant will be responsible for supporting the Adult Ed team in various project related tasks. The ideal candidate should enjoy working with software and technology with an interest in sales / marketing, whose long term goal would be to move into a Project Coordinator, Account Executive or Sales / Marketing position. As the Executive Assistant, you will be expected to work independently, as well as alongside the Director, and must be able to work well under pressure to handle a variety of tasks and confidential matters with discretion. 

Minimum Qualifications:

At least two years of professional experience as an Executive Assistant in a technology-related industry, sales, marketing or higher education background 
Strong organizational skills that reflect the ability to perform and prioritize multiple tasks with excellent attention to detail 
Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel and Powerpoint 
Strong written and verbal communication
SQL knowledge is a plus 

Job Responsibilities:

Learn Focus' product, processes and assist in supporting Focus product as needed
Ensure department and district timelines and milestones are communicated and met
Preparing agendas and documentation for weekly meetings
Daily and/or weekly reports for Director
Research into new districts / sales opportunities and report to Director 
Assisting Director in reviewing and completing change requests, as well as user acceptance testing
Demonstrate the highest level of customer/client service and interest / ability to represent Focus at conferences / demos / trade shows 
Must be willing to travel occasionally 
Flexibility concerning after-hours communication with Executives and availability to travel on short notice is a must

Salary: $35-40k (No other salary/ranges will be considered!)

Focus School Software's compensation package offers the following benefits:
*Medical Insurance
*Dental/Vision Insurance
*Life Insurance
*Short and Long Term Disability Insurance
*401(k) after 6 months
*Paid Holidays
*Paid Vacation and Sick Time
*Casual dress code in office 
*Paid parking in downtown St. Petersburg
*Free lunch on Fridays 
*Popcorn Machine
*Cereal Stations

To apply please visit https://focusschoolsoftware.recruiterbox.com/jobs/fk0hx2z

Thank you and good luck!

Hello. We're a small Tampa-based team building a social app that's almost ready for a friends and family launch. The app is tons of fun and has lots of potential. We're looking to add a second Swift dev to the team to help finish the iOS app. We're looking for someone who would like to join as a cofounder. All the founders receive equal share. So this is the infamous equity gig, not a salary. But those that write software are masters of the universe right now, why waste all your time being a hired gun? Invest a little of your software writing superpower into yourself! If you're interested, drop me a line and I will tell you more about the project.

We are a small yet expanding application development company based in Oldsmar, Florida. We have been in business for over 15 years, but launched a new start-up SaaS application line that has accelerated our need for growth. Our focus is on developing the very best mobile, web and PC applications and building long-term relationships with our clients. 

We are currently looking for a Full Stack C# .NET engineer/architect to add to our growing team. 

We have a varied portfolio of active projects which provides the opportunity for our team members to learn new technologies and diversify their technical development expertise.

Ideal candidates will have the following qualifications: 
-- Experience creating enterprise-level applications using C#, ASP.NET MVC, .NET Web API, SQL Server, HTML/HTML5, CSS3, Javascript
-- Strong knowledge of common design patterns including MVC and MVVM
-- Experience developing responsive solutions for 'any device'
-- Ability to deliver quality solutions to satisfy our team and client's shared vision
-- Excellent debugging and troubleshooting skills
-- Strong experience in professional services or other external settings in which projects must satisfy client objectives including features, quality, and timeline.
-- An understanding of what it means to wear different hats in a small, dynamic team environment, and an eagerness to jump in and help wherever needed
--  Strong interpersonal and communication skills

Familiar with/interested in:
-- jQuery, Bootstrap
-- WebAPI or RESTful APIs
-- Entity Framework
-- Wordpress

Benefits Include:
-- Full-Time (W2) Employee - Not 1099 contract work
-- Competitive Salary
-- Holiday and Vacation Paid Time Off 
-- Health Insurance
-- Small-team, with a comfortable work environment

We enjoy what we do, and we take pride in our work. As a part of our team, you will have an opportunity to directly impact our clients and business on a daily basis. 

If you'd like to explore opportunities with us, please email a cover letter that outlines your interest and compensation expectations along with your resume. 

We are only seeking local candidates that are able to work from our Oldsmar office near Race Track Road and Forest Lakes Blvd.
